name: Python
creator: Guido van Rossum
description: A versatile, high-level programming language known for its readability and broad library support.

name: JavaScript
creator: Brendan Eich
description: The language of the web, used for interactive websites and web applications.

name: Java
creator: James Gosling
description: A class-based, object-oriented language designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

name: C++
creator: Bjarne Stroustrup
description: An extension of C that includes object-oriented features and low-level memory manipulation.

name: C#
creator: Anders Hejlsberg
description: A modern, object-oriented language developed by Microsoft for building a wide range of applications.

name: Ruby
creator: Yukihiro Matsumoto
description: A dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity.

name: PHP
creator: Rasmus Lerdorf
description: A popular general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited to web development.

name: Go
creator: Robert Griesemer, Rob Pike, Ken Thompson
description: A statically typed, compiled language designed at Google for simplicity and reliability.

name: Swift
creator: Apple Inc.
description: A powerful and intuitive programming language for macOS, iOS, watchOS, and tvOS.

name: Kotlin
creator: JetBrains
description: A modern programming language that makes developers happier. Used for Android development.

name: TypeScript
creator: Anders Hejlsberg
description: A strongly typed programming language that builds on JavaScript, giving you better tooling at any scale.

name: Rust
creator: Graydon Hoare
description: A language empowering everyone to build reliable and efficient software.

name: Scala
creator: Martin Odersky
description: A hybrid functional and object-oriented programming language for the JVM.

name: Perl
creator: Larry Wall
description: A high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming language.

name: MATLAB
creator: Cleve Moler
description: A high-performance language for technical computing, visualization, and programming.
